metadata.case_name: Life Insurance Payout Combined with Spousal Inheritance

sources_of_wealth.description: Life insurance payout following spouse's death

extracted_fields.claim_event_description: Death of spouse (Elizabeth Foster) following short illness

extracted_fields.original_source_of_deceased_wealth: 35-year career as Senior Nurse in NHS; consistent saving and pension contributions

sources_of_wealth.notes: Family home already jointly owned with right of survivorship - not included in estate value

missing_fields.reason: Not specified - may be self-employed or employed

sources_of_wealth.notes: Account holder's own savings of £200,000 mentioned but employment details sparse

overlapping_sources_analysis.note: Insurance payout and inheritance both stem from spouse's death but are distinct sources
overlapping_sources_analysis.insurance: Contractual payout from life insurance policy
overlapping_sources_analysis.inheritance: Estate assets (savings/investments) passing under will or intestacy
overlapping_sources_analysis.key_distinction: Insurance proceeds are not part of the estate - they pass directly to named beneficiary

compliance_considerations.insurance_verification: Policy details provided (provider, inception date, trigger event)
compliance_considerations.inheritance_chain: Deceased's wealth clearly explained (NHS career, consistent saving)

recommended_follow_up_questions: What is the name of your employer or are you self-employed as an electrician?
How long have you worked as an electrician?
What is/was your approximate annual income from this work?
Have you now retired, and if so, when?
